title: How can we overcome limitations? - Quora

response.answer_text: In life no matter which aspect you belong to, no matter what your career maybe, no matter how talented you are, there are times when things won’t just go on smoothly as expected, we experience limitations as we grow.  Nevertheless, with a little piece of additional information, you can stumble on the needed solution to your problems, and everything will turnaround. Here are a few tips on how to overcome limit: Believe in yourself : believing you can achieve what you sought after is the first step. it works like magic, many attach it to spiritual laws or law of nature. Whatever, i just know it works, because from the moment you start believing you can achieve whatever you sought after, you start noticing things that will bring you closer to the solution. You get to develop courage too, remember thoughts become realities.Change the wrong negative beliefs: sometimes letting go of wrong old beliefs brings the change we desire. Beliefs are powerful, they may make or mar you, depending on how fast you are to identify them.Role models:- Look for those that have overcome limits like that and learn from them, learning from those who have done it before isn’t a bad idea afterall(Remember the famous saying “Experience is the best teacher”)Be determined and take action: This makes all the difference between wishing for something and achieving it___ACTION. If you really want to overcome your limitations, after reading this, get to work. What do you realy need to change the situation? Go for it. Just get started, Stop talking about it.Never give up- there is no way you will ever overcome your limits if you give up, sometimes just one more trial makes the difference.Attach or find a purpose to what you are doing. This can serve as a great source of motivation.Checkout this article “7 Rules To Overcome Limits And Achieve Success” for more in-depth insight on how to overcome limits.

It all depends on how exactly are you limiting yourself? Therefore you’ll find your own answer on how to stop limiting yourself. But as a general life philosophy, borrow a leaf out of M. Scott Peck’s book: The Road Less Traveled: Life is Hard. When you accept that. Live becomes easy.The reason is simple: Your expectations are really what limit you, not just your actions. Too high or too low expectations will either result in your frustration and anger, or cynicism and loss of faith. Try to rid yourself of all expectations, but keep only those that make yourself feel alive, loved and connected to yourself. On a more practical note: If you aim to achieve and grow, you can always set your expectation (goal) to be 15% higher than what you do now. If that proves too difficult, adjust it down by 5% until it’s achievable. If it’s too easy, adjust it up. Obviously you can’t always calculate the maths to be perfect, you may need to use your intuition with these percentages as a general guide as life will always involve variability. That said, accept your weaknesses, accept your challenges, start where you are with your readjusted expectations, be humble in beginning your path with the work you do, put your head down only to look up at checkpoints and intersections and my friend, when you do look up you’ll be surprised how far you’ve come.

thats the question isn't it? a hell of a lot of trees have died, ink applied to it and words spoken trying figure out how to motivate folks. What has been universally accepted is this. Think of an idea of where you want to be. Write it down. Think of steps to get you there. the more detailed, researched and numerous(and simple) the better. Write it down. Refer to this list often, follow the steps. modify the steps as you grow, learn and complete steps. revisit your idea from time to time, it could be you have moved beyond it, achieved it, or gotten off track. Immerse yourself in the culture, literature and ideas of your goal. this will help you with both the idea, and the steps toward it. Procrastination is a problem, your body and your mind want to comfortable and lazy, this is a problem. I find that when my alarm rings an 5 AM I have a tendency to hit the snooze button 3 or 4 times. this ruins any chance I have of attaining my goals for the day. my mornings are mine, my work has me till evening and evenings are for honey dos and family. So by sleeping in an ruin my steps. to combat this when my alarm rings I count backwards from three. 3..2..1. then I move. the race is on. it helps. Good luck and fair seas.

There is boundless unconditional love, compassion, joy in the joy of others, contentment/equanimity. There are perceptions of infinite consciousness and, space. There is measureless freedom - liberation - from unnecessary suffering. “Nibbana is the highest bliss.” - Dhammapada What we achieve, what we contribute, shouldn't be about quantity but, quality. There is that which can be measured and, there is that which isn't about measurement i.e. more or less - limited or limitless: The Middle Length Discourses of the Buddha “For there is suffering, but none who suffers;Doing exists although there is no doer.Extinction is but no extinguished person;Although there is a path, there is no goer.” - Buddhaghosa

There is a funny part of the query. Suppose you don’t know driving a car and think it to be difficult and are scared for driving for odd reason which could have bearing of some image in mind. A time comes when driving is necessary to be independent to go to work and you take a bold step in learning which of course is not difficult but the fear in mind still exists. You starts driving smaller distance daily and gradually gain the confidence. You no more see the limitation. Achieving beyond limitation exists till one has not achieved and once stepped in the unimaginable thing would appear very simple. However how does this happen? I have some personal experience and later on has been my endeavor in bringing the art in my junior colleagues which is a self- motivating process. More than 30 years ago I was working in another organization and was given responsibility to get electro-dialysis technology form a govt research institute in Gujarat. The technology had many parts like making ion exchange membrane, making a stack which was assembly of numbers of membrane and then establishing a process to desalinate brackish water. I had a small team and we worked with a deep sense of interest. Each step was involving complication in handling a process and / or dealing with unfriendly chemicals. Irony was that I didn’t get enough support from staff except freedom to work and were able to bring a new technology in the organization. Luck as it could be water mission for drinking water by Sam Pitroda in Rajiv Gandhi’s era and the organization being offered a significant order made the technology bring in its manifestation. The people by whom I got the technology in a very small lab scale got excited as it was beyond their knowledge of tackling certain steps not easy in manufacturing scale and I did invite one of them to visit and see himself and feel happy for the hard work they have researched. I switched the organization where I was to create research and development from nonexistence entity then. I had a view that the task suited more for a scientist in PhD or M. Tech but the starting dream was on electro chemical process which I had some idea. Within one and half year we made a patent that passed through in one stroke because it was having some unique dimensions which few global organizations working on the product were not aware and made them think in the technology. These things I see as achievements which were not known or hidden till they were tapped and brought out and of course there was a team involved with me working with same spirit. The idea of achieving beyond limitation then was my mantra in grooming young scientist and engineers and have succeeded to a larger extent. My aim was to keep motivating, giving a freedom but guiding at each step with one important point to get extracted by every individual more than s/he thinks. My job was also to know their education and experience and interest which needs to be explored so that s/he enjoys in the work. It amounted in giving individual attention according to their need and also collective discussion to enjoy them as team. The process was also in bringing transparency with each and has been a huge task which cultivated a culture with difference. Each individual who have worked more than 5 years is proud to know his/her potential much more than they were aware of building their confidence. It is laborious process and needs the mind keep away from unwanted thoughts at least during work. Knowing on self-potential and being confidence and the nature they work has relation with science or technology along with art in working team where they need to keep motivate their subordinate makes a continuous process. Thus I feel proud about it but the individual who have to maintain and feel satisfied have to keep nurturing and adding useful traits without stagnating their thinking is my advice to them and all who read.

A very good start would be to ask yourself this question… WHY am I limiting myself? At the moment you are putting the cart before the horse so to speak, you need to know the why before you can activate the how. Lets hypothetically say that your ‘why’ is a belief you are not good enough. Now lets say I answered your question by saying think positive, never give up, tell yourself yourself are more than capable. That is definitely telling you the ‘how’, but it still hasn’t addressed the ‘why’ that is lurking in the background ready to derail you. Find the why and the how will take care of itself.

That's a wonderful question. Just like in mathematics, some functions have limits. Other functions don't. Thing is, human beings are very complex functions. Therefore, I choose to think of a human individual as a complex function, the domain of which is not clearly defined. Setting a limit when the domain is unknown might account for an error. Therefore, you never know unless you try. And even if you fail, it is still unclear whether what was wrong was the domain or the problem was in the implementation of the function. So setting limits for yourself is rather pointless.

Each and everyone have limitations no one is perfect in this world. And overcoming limitations is a great thing. Follow some of this may be it works for you. Be patient.Think Big and see what possibilities you have.Be with positive people so it keeps you positive.Start saying “NO” if you don’t like anything.Be bold and brave enough to take-up challenges.

Substitute limiting beliefs with de-limiting beliefs. The Lefkoe Method is a wonderful tool for doing this. Remember that its a big universe out there with myriad possibilities and you have as much potential as anyone else. In fact you have way more potential than you can even imagine. People can be remarkably short sighted when it comes to what is possible for them. You have to allow that all things are possible FOR YOU!!! The Lefkoe Institute

That will be a good journey, you need to make an authentic and unique expression of yourself. You can do that by changing your self-image. Self-image is your life script, you live, work, think, behave by the rules of your script. You can confirm or change your script, it’s up to you. When you start that change all your activities following your change in all life fields. If you need some help contact me.

Ultimately we set our own limitations in life and in our existences, the question is if there is something beyond our limitations and the answer would have to be that there always is, since we have set these limits of our own accord, there can be no end, now to overcome limitations, you have to analyze what it that is so limiting about them and why we have given them power over our will.

What limitations?  In fact there are no such things as limitations, can't buy them in a store, can't email them. What you are asking is what thinking patterns have I created to limit myself.  There are as many of these thinking patterns as there are thoughts in peoples heads.  Each of these thinking pattern limitations is unique to your own learning and past experience.  It is placed there by you.   Now for the answer.  Look inside yourself and see your own behaviors, thinking patterns, self talk, self doubt.  These are the only limitations present, all within yourself.  Don't look to others for they have different and unique thinking patterns and learning's.  Watch very very carefully for they are hiding and difficult to see and find.

Take very good care of your whole self. Physical, mental, social, emotional and spiritual health are all important and require maintenance. Imagine the greatest feeling of all. Keep practicing that feeling, for it is at the root of much in life. Allow room for miracles.

Tell Yourself You're Capable and Competent. One way of limiting yourself is to say that you can't or won't do something. ...Believe You are Good Enough, Just as You Are. “I won't get that job because I'm not good enough.” ...Keep Trying and Never Give Up.

Just look at the person a step further to you, how much he works and how high he is pushing his limits to.. example : look at Elon Musk. He is way ahead of others. Be in the learning mode always, your limits will automatically push further. Hope it helps.

Namasthe Achieving any thing has to interest us and also make us feel satisfied, achieving beyond limitations are not impossible, but one needs to make and super human attempt at it, but at the end it is you who need to be satisfied with what you do.

response.answer_text: The question you have asked suggests that you think you are doing just that. However, you have not said in what aspect of your life you are doing this, or how you are doing so. Think about those things and then ask a career counsellor or life coach or someone how to solve the particular problem you have.

Just pray and pray about it that you would like to overcome this. While praying, always hope in what you want. Do these until your prayers are answered. God hears you and just wait on God”s time when He answers your prayers. Don't get discouraged if your prayer isn't answered soon. Your prayers will be eventually answered.
Yes, you can acheive anything beyond the limit with the help of your subconscious mind. Read Dr.Joseph Murphy’s Unleash the power of your subconscious mind.
Think about that thing at least 3 times in morning , 6 times in afternoon and 9 times in evening. This method was basically invented by Sir Telsa , he used to do it for his own motivation everyday

If you know your limits you will never be able to cross it. If you don’t know your limits you will never know when you have crossed your limits. You should be limitless in good sense and shoould know all the limits in bad sense.

Life is the art of transcending limitations and accomplishing maximal evolution thereby. We always do that.
